resources.string: \u2022 your device’s location, to record places you’ve spent time in
\u2022 Bluetooth, to record when your device is near others using this app
This data will also be sent to the NHS so we can understand how coronavirus is spreading.

string.name: explanation_link
string.u: See how we’ll use this data

resources.string: You’ll be asked to consent to these permissions on the next screen.
To trace people who you come into contact with, this app will automatically access:
Have you been diagnosed with coronavirus?
You need to isolate yourself and stay at home
This app has recorded all contact you’ve had with other people using this app over the past 14 days.
Sharing this information with the NHS means we can notify these people to take steps to keep themselves safe.
How you can protect yourself and others

This is a real-time status based on people you’ve been in contact with.

You’ll get an alert if your status changes.

 It’s important that you tell us if you develop any new symptoms.

You can stay safe by washing your hands more regularly and avoiding large gatherings of people.

Visit NHS 111 for more advice on protecting yourself and people you care about.

Thank you for helping us slow the spread of coronavirus.
Use our online tool to check your symptoms.
